comments.body: First of all, the phantom dies in the sun, so it wouldn't "get there during the day", and second, how would the phantom capture treasures, as it doesnt have arms?

You are right DarkstalkerMoon i meant they would get there at dusk and stay there over day.

They would bring their captured treasures into the caves with their mouths, just like eagles in real life, for example, transport a rabbit into their nest
That is a very cool idea.
They never called the stone in the Deep Dark marble. They didn't really talk about any of the stone at all
never said they did. But most players call it marble
I think it would be better if you could cut the tendrils of the sensor with a shear.
But how would that work? Wouldn't that just give us a useless sculk sensor?
i think their point is that theyd grow back

I actually think it would be funnier if the ceiling was made mostly out of regular gravel. Then players would have to be careful not to break blocks too close to the ceiling, and be especially careful not to let a creeper blow up in these caves.
394286328392 I thinked about that too but it will be very annoying and performance hungry maybe with zones with regular gravel and zones with compact gravel? I want your opinion

Hello everyone (the 2 persons that follow my post) what about special archaeological sites in the gravel caves in zones were the ceiling falled and there are new and unexpected pieces and discoveries? if you like the idea I will edit the post and incorporate the idea.

Personally I see this as a way more fitting addition as "termites" or "meerkats", which would introduce respectively a frustrating unnecessary problem and a complicated way to solve it.

Also, a new pet that can fly and also fight would be a very welcome feature.
It sounds the digging wasp around where I live, however believe they are solitary.
EDIT: I’m changing the post category to "Caves & Cliffs" as it seems more appropriate for that category
Maybe this could be a new section that could spawn in the existing mineshafts? Just because there would not be a big difference between the abandoned mineshaft and the collapsed one.
We don't need bronze or tin, Minecraft is meant to be simple so that pretty much anyone can play it, if you really want to play with bronze use a mod like Thermal Expansion
Так олово это не сплав а самородный металл,просто добавьте чтобы олово было добывать из пещер и шахт.
Так олово это не сплав а самородный металл,просто добавьте чтобы олово было добывать из пещер и шахт.
Как это бронза и олово не нужны,ещё как нужны, хватит выпендриваться, Понятно.

The developer for the Warden WANTS them to be as OP as possible. You are not meant to fight it, but instead avoid it as best as possible. If it was made weaker, everyone would kill it, ruining the original purpose for the Warden.
Yeah the warden was supposed to be minecrafts insta kill horror mob

The point is not to fight it, but to sneak around it... 

Geez, what is it with some fighters? Sometimes you have to accept that not everything can't be killed

They did this on purpose so players would not go trying to spawn the Warden on purpose... they made it OP so they would not do that. The purpose of The Warden is not some cool little "boss" thing (though it would be cool if they had a Deep Dark Boss), the purpose of The Warden is to SNEAK around it

 

Edit: Also, it drops absolutely nothing. What reason would you have to kill it in the first place?

Sure, the warden is overpowered... and the Minecraft developers did make it to be sneaked around and avoided as possible, but what if we fail at sneaking and it starts to attack us???? At least make it either less op, easier to beat, easier to sneak around, OR easy to run away from it. I also want this because the only people I play with are my mom and Brandon. and they both are less good than me in Minecraft. I want noobs, pros, and even hackers to be treated equally. I want equality!
yeah the worst part is the ranged attack and them spawning multiple. like mojang make one of them spawn at a time with a cooldown
cool idea hope it gets into the game
I agree. This would definitely give us a chance to escape. Although it would also give the players a better chance to kill it. So I would say shorten it to 5 seconds so that is isn’t as Overpowered.
It should stun all mobs

I wouldn't mind them looking like identical candles, there are already many blocks that look a like. A few more won't hurt. If its nessicary, the candle could receive a little soul symbol in item form.
This is true, but I do feel this would save some of the unnecessary pain of adding the items for the editors, and inventory space for the players
I entirely agree. Even with mob farms, gathering xp is tedious and completely removes from the fun of the game. Sitting for hours only collecting xp makes the game almost unplayable in survival.

yeah sonds great!
But tadpoles need water...
Maybe they could also be unharmed in lava, and their tadpoles can come from the lava as well?
yeah but maybe in bedrock it could create a light source when you hold it so you don't have to place torches every where

Instead of iron, I think this would be a GREAT way to use copper as more than just a decorative block, lightning rod, archeological brush, and spyglass. Adding a chain would make it a chandelier, and you could use up to four different candle colors.

To be able to add to the varieties of plants and fungus, would make the world seem more than asked. It would give a exciting feel to what is already so fun. To be able to have the old flowers and fungus be remodeled and to also then add new ones would make for a really unique touch, a new feeling into the game. It would be a minor tweak but I believe it would be very well received.
This is this is a great idea, as the warden, and the deep dark at that, are all heavily related to vibrations, so it would be cool if they themselves could used vibrations themselves!
What on earth do you mean, "To prevent Cheese"???????????????????????????????/
Cheese is where people will build up and kill the warden same as the iron golem your welcome
or maybe change the name to, "a perfect sunset"
This will be a good way to get deepslate without having to mine below y 0.
Esta biel la idea
dude I don't understand why some people see an idea in a language and reply to it in another

I like the idea of path blocks giving horses a speed buff and I've heard others mentioning that it would be a great buff.
I actually dislike the idea of enchantments being used with horses but instead how about horses gaining stats the more the horse uses each of it's abilities, such as jumping at critical mark enough times allows higher jumps.
Also a problem I usually have early on is that saddles are hard to find, so they should be craftable with a lead, leather and iron ingots.

It's been a decade, we need a horse buff! Definitely enchanted horse armor including feather falling. I think we deserve netherite horse armor, since it's not craftable it can be an end-specific treasure or upgraded using the diamond one at the upgrade bench. Two-player riding would be nice, and I would love leaves to be easier to traverse by lowering or removing the collision hitbox while riding through leaves. Basically, make it so that while on horseback you can travel through leaves. Horse whistles and horseshoes are great mods that I think should come to vanilla but I understand that they might not fit the theme of vanilla. I think horse whistle because dogs and cats can teleport but horses can not. This would give you ease of use while sacrificing an inventory slot. I'll pray for some horse buffs in 1.22
yes we need more life in water caves!
This is a super amazing idea. I think it would add a lot of immersion and another reason to explore early game!
Most definitely this be way better they can start on a mountain and lead in to rivers

Maybe it is an achievement

Achievement made: Loot for life

I love the lore potential, even ties into my own idea the Warden is actually protecting and cultivating the skulk growth and sensors, for what purpose it's hard to say. If indeed the Warden is from another dimension though, I think it needs some sort of interaction with Endermen then as well. Enderman lore-wise are not from the End, and exists in every dimension, meaning either Wardens and Endermen are friendly or potentially hostile towards each other. Now, the interaction could be something simple like Enderman run if they hear a Warden roar (which honestly would add some more tension) or more Endermen spawn in the Deep Dark and the Warden ignores them. Giving some risk of line-up sights with an Enderman (making the duration required shorter), Endermen attacking the player making too much noise and summoning the Warden.
oui cela devrait être vrais !
This is a really big problem. The caves themselves are great but I struggle to find them a lot and usually need to dig down for a while to find them.

You want to PROMOTE killing Axolotls? Are you crazy? My water kittens!!

I do think it's a good idea though, maybe with the regenerating limbs point, a foot can drop if something attacks it, instead of just killing it outright, because I could never bring myself to kill them.
